gurmukhi: sMgm sMjog pRym nym kau pqMgu jwnY ibrh ibEg sog mIn Bl jwneI
transliteration: Sangam Sanjog Praym Naym Kau Patangu Jaanai , Birah Biaog Sog Meen Bhal Jaanaee ?
translation: The loving atmosphere that gets generated when a lover is about to meet his beloved can best be known by a moth. The pang of separation is best described by a fish that has been separated from its beloved water.

gurmukhi: iek tk dIpk iDAwn pRwn prhrY sill ibEg mIn jIvn n mwneI
transliteration: Ik Tak Deepak Dhiaan Praan Paraharai , Salil Biaog Meen Jeevan N Maanaee ?
translation: A moth burns itself for the love of the flame that he keeps watching and playing with. Similarly a fish separated from water has no meaning of life. She dies when out of it.

gurmukhi: crn kml imil ibCurY mDup mnu kpt snyh DiRgu jnmu AigAwneI
transliteration: Charan Kamal Mili Bichhurai Madhoup Manu , Kapat Sanayh Dhrigu Janamu Agiaanaee ?
translation: These living beings i.e. moth and fish lay down their lives in love of their beloveds. On the other hand an evil person's mind is like a black bee that hops from one flower to the other. It separates from the holy feet of True Guru, even after meeting Him

gurmukhi: inhPl jIvn mrn gur ibmuK huie pRym Aru ibrh n doaU aur AwneI ]300]
transliteration: Nihadhal Jeevan Maran Gur Bimoukh Hui , Praym Aru Birah N Dooo Ur Aanaee ?300?
translation: A follower of his own heart turned away from the refuge of the Guru, who does not feel the pangs of separation and love of the holy feet of the. True Guru, has wasted away his birth and death thus living a worthless life. (300)
